text: hello this is chef john from food
whooshes comm with artichoke kirtan
usually this is done in a big casserole
dish but i'm doing individual artichoke
our dinner time this makes a great
appetizer very cool also could be a side
dish so what we're gonna use for this is
artichoke hearts packed in water i
prefer the ones that come in a jar like
this versus the can these also have a
little bit of the stem attached which is
nice these are from Trader Joe's so to
find these you want to check out the
fancier grocery store chains or if
you're in a big city go check Italian
markets Greek markets but you're looking
for artichoke hearts
so the prep on this is really simple
you're simply gonna cut the artichoke
hearts in half and then place them face
down all right cut side down on some
paper towels to drain for at least 15
minutes very important all that liquid
gets absorbed by the paper we need dry
artichoke hearts for this to work really
well all right so once those have
drained I'm gonna put those on a
slightly oiled foiled sheet tray I'm
gonna kind of Nestle them up together so
they all sit flat because I want that
broiler heat to hit them all evenly I'm
gonna season those with salt and black
pepper all right so after they're
seasoned we're gonna use plain fine dry
breadcrumbs and we're talking about
maybe half a teaspoon on each all right
so that's the first layer that's gonna
kind of fuse with the remaining moisture
in the artichoke to sort of make like a
little layer of stuffing sort of alright
so after the breadcrumb goes down
freshly grated Parmesan cheese the real
stuff the Reggiano parmesan from the
expensive cheese section do not use fake
cheese by the way when's the last recipe
we did where I said you know what use
the fake cheese go ahead alright I'll
never say that always get the real
parmesan alright and last but not least
a little drizzle of olive oil just a few
drops on each just to make it a little
more broiler friendly we're gonna put
our broiler on high we are going to
preheat it and we're gonna place those
artichoke hearts under the broiler about
five or six inches away from the heat
until they're done I'll give you a time
because you know you don't notice if I
don't I'm gonna say mine took about
seven minutes but it's gonna depend and
there they are sizzling away bubbling
away
a broiling away I find it very very
exciting to watch but then again I don't
have a lot going on and that's it
beautiful incredibly delicious artichoke
heart great on these make a great passed
hors d'oeuvre or like I said you could
just use these as a side dish for a
steak piece of chicken whatever and I'm
gonna print that mine on this deviled
egg tray which i think looks kind of
cool a little fresh lemon in the middle
you probably have a doubled eggs tray
and you're not making deviled eggs for
the party because you know those are so
overdone they are like the bacon of eggs
now this could be finger food but
depending on how dainty your friends are
you may want to put out some toothpicks
you know just to make it look good and
there we go man was that delicious these
are perfect warm or room temperature not
so great cold
not so great piping hot cuz people will
get annoyed when they you know burn the
roof of their mouth so let them cool
down a little now of course if you want
to fancy these up maybe some hot pepper
or maybe some fresh herb maybe a
different cheese maybe I don't know you
tell me so let me know if you think of
any great alterations on this I really
hope you give these a try all the
ingredients are on the site and as
always enjoy
